title: Location Hierarchies
content:

Location Hierarchies

 

  • Location Hierarchies
    • Creating a Location Hierarchy
    • Editing a Location Hierarchy
    • Deleting a Location Hierarchy
      • Field Description
      • Action Buttons

Location Hierarchy is a system that is used to describe the different levels of a location. This hierarchy can be defined using the attributes of the locations.

Hierarchies are dynamically created based on the attributes defined at each level and the defined level sequence.

Users can create, view, or edit the various available location hierarchy levels on this page.

By default, 'Primary' location hierarchy is created with the below attributes and level sequence.

Region → District → LocationId

 

Filters

  • Location Hierarchy
  • Description

 

Creating a Location Hierarchy

 

To create a new Location Hierarchy:

 

  1. Select Menu > Configurations > Location Configurations > Location Hierarchies.
  2. Enter the filter criteria and click Apply. You will see the records on the list pane.
  3. Click Create to view the Location Hierarchy window.
  4. Enter the Location Hierarchy and Description.
  5. Select a Location Hierarchy Level and click Save.
Note: All mandatory fields are denoted with *.

Editing a Location Hierarchy

 

To edit a Location Hierarchy:

 

Swipe-out List

  1. Select Menu > Configurations > Location Configurations > Location Hierarchies
  2. Enter the filter criteria and click Apply. You will see the records on the list pane.
  3. Select the required hierarchy record. Swipe-out the menu on the required record card and select Edit.
  4. In the Location Hierarchy window, modify the required fields.
  5. Click Save to save the modified hierarchy details.

Edit View

  1. Select the required policy record card. The action buttons are displayed in the footer section.
  2. Click Edit to view the Location Hierarchy window, modify the required fields.
  3. Click Save to save the modified hierarchy details.

 

Deleting a Location Hierarchy

 

Swipe-out List

  1. Select Menu > Configurations > Location Configurations > Location Hierarchies.
  2. Enter the filter criteria and click Apply. You will see the records on the list pane.
  3. Swipe-out menu on the required record card and select Delete.
  4. A confirmation pop-up prompts as 'Deletion of Location Hierarchy is irreversible'.
  5. Click Yes to delete the policy.

Delete

  1. Select the required record card. The footer section with action buttons is displayed.
  2. Select Delete.
  3. A confirmation pop-up prompts as 'Deletion of Location Hierarchy is irreversible'.
  4. Click Yes to delete the policy.

 

Field Description

Following are the field descriptions of the attributes available on the screen.

 

Field

 

Description

 
Location Hierarchy Specifies the location hierarchy name.
Description The description of the hierarchy.
Created By Specifies the name of the user who created the location hierarchy.
Created Timestamp Specifies the date and time of the creation of the location hierarchy.

 

Action Buttons

The following are the action buttons available on the screen.

 

Select All Rows Selects all the rows of records on the screen.
Export Exports the list of location hierarchy attributes, and the file will be downloaded onto your system. View Export for more information.
Create Opens the Location Hierarchy window. 
Deselect Clears the selected records.
Details Opens the Location Hierarchy window displaying details of the selected record.
Edit Opens the Location Hierarchy window for editing the selected record.
Delete Deletes the selected record.
Expand All The Location Hierarchy Level displays the Level Sequence number and Location Attribute Id as Region, District, and Location Id. 
Collapse All The Location Hierarchy Level will not display the Level Sequence number and Location Attribute Id.
